etymologies: Old English wudurofe, from wudu ‘wood’ + an element of unknown meaning

definitions: a white-flowered plant of the bedstraw family with whorled leaves, smelling of new-mown hay when dried or crushed.

notes.text: Genera Galium and Asperula, family Rubiaceae: several species, especially sweet woodruff (G. odoratum)

shortDefinitions: white-flowered Eurasian plant with whorled leaves
